Eureka ML Insights

eureka_ml_insights.core package

Submodules

eureka_ml_insights.core.data_join module

Module for joining datasets using pandas merge functionality.

This module defines the DataJoin class, which inherits from DataProcessing, and provides methods to merge two pandas DataFrames with flexible join types. The module also includes a factory class method for construction from a configuration object.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.data_join.DataJoin(data_reader_config, output_dir, other_data_reader_config, pandas_merge_args, output_data_columns=None)

Bases: DataProcessing

Joins two datasets using pandas merge functionality.

classmethod from_config(config)

Creates a DataJoin instance from a configuration object.

Parameters:

config – A configuration object containing all required initialization attributes.

Returns:

An instance of the DataJoin class.

Return type:

DataJoin

run()

Executes the data join operation and writes the result to the output directory.

eureka_ml_insights.core.data_processing module

class eureka_ml_insights.core.data_processing.DataProcessing(data_reader_config, output_dir, output_data_columns=None)

Bases: Component

Implements data reading, transformation, and output writing for a pipeline component.

classmethod from_config(config)

Create a DataProcessing instance from a configuration object.

Parameters:

config – A configuration object with data_reader_config, output_dir, and output_data_columns.

Returns:

An instance of DataProcessing.

Return type:

DataProcessing

get_desired_columns(df)

Get the desired columns from the DataFrame, including necessary reserved columns.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The DataFrame from which columns will be selected.

Returns:

The DataFrame containing only the desired columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

run()

Run the data processing steps.

Loads the dataset, applies transformations (if any), selects desired columns, and writes the output as a JSONL file.

Return type:

None

write_output(df)

Write the transformed DataFrame to a JSONL file.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the data to write.

eureka_ml_insights.core.data_processing.compute_hash(val)

Compute the MD5 hash of a given string.

Parameters:

val (str) – The string to be hashed.

Returns:

The MD5 hash of the input string.

Return type:

str

eureka_ml_insights.core.data_union module

Module for data union functionality.

This module provides a DataUnion class which concatenates two datasets using pandas concat functionality.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.data_union.DataUnion(data_reader_config, output_dir, other_data_reader_config, output_data_columns=None, dedupe_cols=None)

Bases: DataProcessing

Concatenates two datasets using pandas concat functionality.

classmethod from_config(config)

Creates a DataUnion instance from a configuration object.

Parameters:

config – Configuration object containing initialization parameters.

Returns:

The newly created DataUnion instance.

Return type:

DataUnion

run()

Concatenates two DataFrames, optionally deduplicates them, and writes the result.

This method:

  • Loads two datasets using the configured data readers.

  • Concatenates them with pandas.concat.

  • Optionally drops duplicates based on dedupe_cols.

  • Filters columns to output_data_columns if provided.

  • Writes the final DataFrame to the specified output directory.

eureka_ml_insights.core.eval_reporting module

This module provides functionality to read data, compute metrics, visualize results, and write reports through the EvalReporting class and its supporting components.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.eval_reporting.EvalReporting(data_reader_config, output_dir, metric_config=None, aggregator_configs=None, visualizer_configs=None)

Bases: Component

Reads data from a given dataset, computes metrics, writes results, and passes results to a reporter.

data_reader

An instance of a data reader that loads the dataset.

metric

An instance of a metric calculator to evaluate the data, if specified.

reporter

A Reporter object responsible for generating the final report.

classmethod from_config(config)

Creates an EvalReporting instance from a configuration object.

Parameters:

config (object) – An object containing all necessary configuration for EvalReporting.

Returns:

An initialized instance of EvalReporting.

Return type:

EvalReporting

run()

Executes the reporting pipeline.

Loads the dataset, evaluates it with the metric (if provided), writes the metric results to a file (if metric_config is specified), and then generates a report.

eureka_ml_insights.core.inference module

This module provides the Inference class, which extends the Component class to handle inference processes for a given dataset and model configuration. It supports resuming from existing inference results, applying rate limiting, and running parallel inferences.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.inference.Inference(model_config, data_config, output_dir, resume_from=None, new_columns=None, requests_per_minute=None, max_concurrent=1, chat_mode=False)

Bases: Component

Handles inference processes for a given dataset and model configuration.

fetch_previous_inference_results()

Loads the contents from the resume_from file and validates alignment with the current model configuration.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The DataFrame with previous inference results.

  • The highest uid value that was processed.

Return type:

Tuple[pd.DataFrame, int]

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the ‘model_output’ or ‘is_valid’ columns are not found in the resume_from file.

  • ValueError – If the sample inference call returns invalid results.

  • ValueError – If there is a mismatch between the columns in the resume_from file and the model’s expected keys.

classmethod from_config(config)

Creates an Inference instance from a provided configuration object.

Parameters:

config – A configuration object containing attributes: model_config, data_loader_config, output_dir, resume_from, new_columns, requests_per_minute, max_concurrent, and chat_mode.

Returns:

An instance of the Inference class.

Return type:

Inference

retrieve_exisiting_result(data, pre_inf_results_df)

Retrieves a valid previous inference result for a given data record.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data record to be inferenced.

  • pre_inf_results_df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing previous inference results.

Returns:

The updated data record with previous model outputs if valid, otherwise None.

Return type:

dict or None

run()

Executes the inference process, optionally resuming from previous results, and writes the final results to the output file.

This method manages parallel execution with a ThreadPoolExecutor, performs rate limiting if specified, and tracks progress with a tqdm progress bar.

validate_response_dict(response_dict)

Validates that the response dictionary contains the mandatory fields ‘model_output’ and ‘is_valid’.

Parameters:

response_dict (dict) – The response dictionary returned by the model.

Raises:

ValueError – If ‘model_output’ or ‘is_valid’ is missing.

eureka_ml_insights.core.pipeline module

This module defines an abstract base class for pipeline components and a pipeline class that orchestrates the execution of these components sequentially.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.pipeline.Component(output_dir, **_)

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for pipeline components.

This class provides the basic interface for all components in the pipeline, ensuring they define a ‘run’ method and can be instantiated from a config.

Parameters:

  • output_dir (PathLike) – The directory where the component’s output should be stored.

  • **_ (Dict[str, Any]) – Additional keyword arguments.

classmethod from_config(config)

Creates an instance of the component from the provided configuration.

Parameters:

config (ComponentConfig) – The configuration for the component.

Returns:

An instance of the component.

Return type:

T

Raises:

NotImplementedError – This method must be implemented in subclasses.

abstract run()

Executes the component’s main functionality.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – This method must be implemented in subclasses.

Return type:

None

class eureka_ml_insights.core.pipeline.Pipeline(component_configs, log_dir)

Bases: object

A pipeline that executes a list of components in sequence.

Parameters:

  • component_configs (List[ComponentConfig]) – A list of component configurations.

  • log_dir (str) – The directory for pipeline logs.

run()

Runs all the components in the pipeline in order.

Return type:

None

eureka_ml_insights.core.prompt_processing module

This module provides functionalities for prompt processing, including a function to compute an MD5 hash and a class that extends DataProcessing to handle prompt generation workflows.

class eureka_ml_insights.core.prompt_processing.PromptProcessing(data_reader_config, output_dir, output_data_columns=None, prompt_template_path=None, ignore_failure=False)

Bases: DataProcessing

Handles the prompt generation workflow by extending DataProcessing.

classmethod from_config(config)

Create a PromptProcessing instance from a configuration object.

Parameters:

config – The configuration object.

Returns:

A new PromptProcessing instance.

Return type:

PromptProcessing

run()

Execute the prompt processing workflow.

Loads input data, optionally uses a Jinja template to create prompts, and writes output data with generated prompts and their hashes to the output directory.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during prompt creation and ignore_failure is False.

Return type:

None

eureka_ml_insights.core.prompt_processing.compute_hash(val)

Compute the MD5 hash of a given string.

Parameters:

val (str) – The value to be hashed.

Returns:

The MD5 hash of the given value.

Return type:

str

eureka_ml_insights.core.reserved_names module

This module defines reserved column names used by Eureka for inference and prompt processing.

The variables in this module list the columns that may be removed or overwritten by Eureka if present in the data.

eureka_ml_insights.core.reserved_names.INFERENCE_RESERVED_NAMES = ['model_output', 'is_valid', 'response_time', 'n_output_tokens']

Reserved column names used for inference outputs and status.

Type:

list of str

eureka_ml_insights.core.reserved_names.PROMPT_PROC_RESERVED_NAMES = ['prompt_hash', 'prompt', 'uid', 'data_point_id', 'data_repeat_id', '__hf_task', '__hf_split']

Reserved column names used for prompt processing.

Type:

list of str

Module contents

class eureka_ml_insights.core.Component(output_dir, **_)

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for pipeline components.

This class provides the basic interface for all components in the pipeline, ensuring they define a ‘run’ method and can be instantiated from a config.

  • **_ (Dict[str, Any]) – Additional keyword arguments.
